result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Erasmo L Guzman was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Search for employment. May not be employed with a business that is licensed to sell alcohol unless approved by the agent, specifically a restaurant. Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol and drug counseling and relationship counseling. Defendant to get a pshychological evaluation. Comply with all Family Court orders and Child Support obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: 7 months to be served up front, 5 months are stayed. Huber for employment or treatment. ***210 days of credit go towards the 7 months, remaining 140 days of credit to be applied to the 2 yrs initial confinement if revoked.***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erasmo L Guzman

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: ***DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING***
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Erasmo L Guzman in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Defendant Erasmo L Guzman in custody. Chris Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is resolved.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - Dismissed.   Cts 3&4 - DRI.
BTC: Bond is revoked, PSI ordered.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

***AMENDED COMPLAINT ATTACHED***
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Pre-trial conference on February 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Erasmo L Guzman in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Defendant Erasmo L Guzman in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
